intro: Strobilanthes rhytisperma, commonly known as the "Kerala flame flower," is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its striking orange-red inflorescences, which resemble flames, making it a visually distinctive species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in evergreen forests. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its unique floral structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
